intro: Opilia thorelii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and prefers bright, indirect light. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, pink, and white, bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions. Opilia thorelii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
